A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Not sure what movie these expert critics are watching\, but honestly what a disservice this film did to the great characters that Force Awakens gave us. The movie wastes almost a full hour on a gaudy casino scene with relatively little substance or impact on overall story\, wasting precious time that could be devoted to developing an intriguing master-pupil relationship between Luke/Rey\, as well as backstory into Jedi Lore and what happened to Luke and Kylo. Instead\, Rey remains a static character with no real moral conflict or intrigue. The overall structure of the Rebel story-line is low-stakes (but drags on throughout the whole movie ending in a weak Hoth-redux). Additionally\, Finn and Rey's relationship is wasted\, as the only have 10 seconds of camera time together in the ENTIRE film. This movie could have been a great dive into the idea of balance in the Force\, fixing the mistakes of the prequels. Instead\, it falls into the same trap of over-ambition without detailed story structure. At least there isn't a line about sand (although there is one about salt).
